content.text: Sales growth shows whether customers are buying more products or services from the company. It reflects market demand and competitive strength.
Formula: Sales Growth % = (Current Year Sales − Previous Year Sales) ÷ Previous Year Sales × 100
Example: If sales grow from ₹1,000 crore to ₹1,200 crore, growth = (1200 − 1000) / 1000 = 20%.
Consistent sales growth over many years is better than one-time spikes caused by temporary demand.
